content.value: The concept of harmony and the primary interaction model inspired the microcontroller design, including its material selection and sensor engineering. Its circuitry, industrial and interaction designs were optimized from multiple user feedback. This was crucial to achieving a balance between form and function.

content.value: On the web version, I utilized P5.js and Tone.js libraries for music playback. For this physical version, I opted for Processing and Beats (a MIDI control software) to dynamically adjust the pace and pitch of the music on the fly.
We retrieved data from R/GA Reporter, which is part of R/GA OS and a database containing collaboration data for every office.

The original data details every individual’s contribution to projects in the aspects of the role, time, and duration. We assessed, cleaned, and grouped the data in a more understandable form: a timeline ranging from January 2017 to October 2019, recording monthly collaborations across 5 Asia-Pacific offices.

content.value: To manage my limited time effectively, I adopted a priority matrix to evaluate feature requests and bug reports based on their impact on usability. This helped me to focus on the most crucial tasks.

fields.title: Kaleidoscope - The ask from the team

content.value: The ask from the team is to provide a secure/restricted web portal that allows the team to iterate over design and content continuously with minimum cost. Based on the request, we implemented a static single-page microsite with a login screen, which adopts the headless CMS (contentful) and serverless infrastructure to have the best flexibility, security, usability, and lowest cost (almost $0 running cost).

content.value: The design system is one outcome of the collaboration between the design engineering team and the design team.

Delivered using Flutter, Google’s latest mobile technology platform, the app was built once and deployed twice for iOS and Android, which also unlocked the possibility of having a singular experience across all mobile devices.

fields.title: Beyond Time - Aging Research Video
fields.description: Research - How Japanese's facial wrinkles and spots change across different age stages

content.value: The executive creative director of the Samsung account in R/GA recounted that our work contributed significantly to the campaign development. As a result, the Mill made four commercials for the campaign. The outcome was heavily based on the generative expressions, and the four commercials ran across globally for several months.

fields.title: Background
fields.description: A Samsung installation in partnership with renowned photographer Carlos Serrao, to feature Galaxy S7 mobile phone.

content.value: It is an installation experienced in pairs. Inside the installation, two participants will be transported through multiple passages of time by digital facial aging and rejuvenation: A parent becomes younger than their child; Lovers glimpse each other before they meet; Friends grow old together in the blink of an eye.

Meanwhile, participants are prompted to engage in tailored conversations around memories, hopes, and dreams in the context of their passages of time, revealing aspects that participants may not share with each other, experiencing aging and evaluating their relationships in new ways, beyond the current time.

fields.title: Imagine a customer is using the mobile app to book

content.value: Imagine a customer is using the mobile app to book a seat. By tapping a button, they would be transported to an AR view that displays a highly immersive representation of themselves seated in a business class seat. This would be achieved by segmenting their legs and body and placing them in the virtual scene, making it feel like they are actually sitting in the business class seat. To add a fun twist, we even thought about showcasing an economy seat for comparison, which would give customers a clearer idea of the differences and potentially entice them to upgrade to business class.

fields.title: Academy - Layout Design
fields.description: Animation Loop Design

fields.title: mood - We designed the music player to be a cylindrical shape

content.value: We designed the music player to be a cylindrical shape in white color, positioned on top of a square table that functions as the square playground in the prototype. Each corner of the table represents a unique style, and the distance between the music player and the corner determines the extent to which that style influences the final music. Users can stand in front of the table, move the music player on the table, and hear the blended music emanating from the table.

In the following scenes, users can see nature scenery inside the infinity display, tilt their phone and pan around. Users can touch and trigger animations of S8's rear camera, taking a picture and saving it to the secured folder. All the animations were done with CSS to minimize the asset size. The water resistance scene uses various kinds of shader rendering, such as God Ray, distortion, to create a realistic underwater view. The 3D phone is a colliding entity that can bounce other 3D bubbles away.

content.value: ClouD is an interactive installation that was showcased at Shanghai International Science & Art Exhibition in 2013 and received the
“Award for Outstanding Works of Science and Art”
Inspired by the geographical positions of 5 offices, we structured the visualization in a pentagon shape.

Sine waves were used as the primary geometry in TouchDesigner to produce sound waves, with the colors defining different disciplines. Collaborations in 5 disciplines are translated to parallel waves, connecting R/GA offices across Asia-Pacific.

fields.title: Beyond Time - Step by Step Experience 5

content.value: 1000 Hours is designed to address a simple need: tracking time spent practicing a habit.
Unlike other trackers that are filled with numerous reminders and complicated features, 1000 Hours is focused on helping users quickly and easily record every minute spent towards their goal.
The perspective view provides an overview of how multiple offices collaborate at a specific point in time.

fields.title: Innovation
fields.description: The world-first, scientifically accurate, fully 3D, real-time Age Simulation Engine.

content.value: Based on the horizon and seascape metaphor, air and water elements were mapped as thematic concepts for the generative expressions. The air and water elements were ordered sequentially — galaxy, fog, smoke, airflow, droplet, meander, wave, and swarm.

Each component has a separate demo page in the gallery, demonstrating all the functions and variations available for use. Developers can easily open this gallery from the app and check how to use each component via interactive demos and code examples.

content.value: During the development process, I put significant effort into optimizing app performance and enhancing the code structure. To prioritize user data privacy, all user data is stored locally within the app. This eliminates the need for a login process and internet connection, simplifying the overall user experience. The app also features minimal opacity transitions and optimized widget functions, resulting in a smoother experience when using Flutter.

content.value: The 3D facial capture and rendering capabilities of our engine provide a high level of realism in the simulation. The engine accurately depicts environmental lighting, captures minor facial expressions, and generates dynamic skin wrinkling in real-time. This level of detail enhances the participants' engagement in the experience and enables them to connect emotionally as they journey through different stages of life.

After researching and surveying, we realized many innovative works within R/GA came from cross-disciplinary collaborations. Thus, we highlighted and color-coded 5 major disciplines  (business & marketing, production, strategy, design, and technology) in the dataset.

fields.title: Zig - app for lifestyle & mobility
fields.subtitle: ComfortDelGro
fields.description:
Zig is a mobile lifestyle platform that innovatively combines journey planning, transport booking, and lifestyle discovery into an all-in-one mobile app built for the global land transport giant ComfortDelGro.

Leveraging multidisciplinary consulting design and technology teams from R/GA, Zig is crafted from the ground up using modern technology, design, and branding, creating unique value for users and becoming Singapore’s first-ever mobility lifestyle platform.

content.value: The birth of 1000 Hours was inspired by my wife's quest to track her dance practice time. Despite searching, she couldn't find an app that met her needs. With my recent experience developing Zig, a comprehensive app with many advanced features, I confidently promised her that I could create an app tailored to her needs in just three days.
However, I was surely overconfident at that moment. It took me three months to finally complete the essential features of 1000 Hours.

fields.title: mood - Maker Faire Recording

content.value: Powered by a data-driven lean technology stack, Zig is providing users access to a myriad of functions:
finding the best route for their trips
comparing transport prices
booking and paying for taxi rides
discovering attractions and experiences curated to match their preferences
explore restaurants, make reservations, order takeaway
finding promotions and deals
many more.

content.value: One of the core innovations in this project is a bespoke 3D facial age simulation engine I developed from scratch for the experience.

The foundation of this technology lies in a century of Shiseido’s extensive scientific research on skin science and knowledge from experts in senescence technology from Hokkaido Information University.

content.value: Light Canvas is an interactive installation at I Light that invites you to turn your movements into illuminations on the reactive digital canvas. The audience can use the flashlight from their mobile phone to fill the installation with stunning light drawings.

The creators of Light Canvas invited me to perform at the festival as a demonstration of the installation's interactivity and potential for creativity. The goal of my performance was to generate a sense of awe and interest among the public.

content.value: I developed this system to explore such a possibility. Using XBee and 3D printing, I created this ball-shaped wireless heart rate monitor, which constantly sends real-time data to computers. With the video player I built with Chrome extension, the audience can actively affect the combination of movie clips by changing their heart rate. The higher their heart rate is, the more intense the spot will be.

The installation was announced the winner of the digital experiential category for Creative Review UK in 2017. It won the responsive environments category for One Show 2017.

fields.title: In Unity, we utilized a Universal Rendering Pip

content.value: In Unity, we utilized a Universal Rendering Pipeline and a pencil effect to create a portal effect.

fields.title: mood - Instead of using light-sensing technology

content.value: Instead of using light-sensing technology like in an optical mouse, which would not allow users to lift the music player above the table, I opted for Radio Frequency (RF) Sensors after conducting research. At the core of this technology is an RF emitter that continuously emits radio waves. These waves travel through space and their signal strength changes with distance. A corresponding RF receiver captures these altered waves and determines the distance to the emitter.

fields.title: Kaleidoscope - Website built for R/GA’s pitch

content.value: “Team Kaleidoscope” is a website built for R/GA’s pitch for the University of Melbourne.

fields.title: I have two cats Bobo and Mumu

content.value: I have two cats Bobo and Mumu, and I have drawn some portraits and comics inspired by their daily life.

fields.title: Initially, we were drawn to the potential of new for

content.value: Initially, we were drawn to the potential of new forms of content such as Augmented Reality (AR), Virtual Reality (VR), Mixed Reality (MR), and Extended Reality (XR). We saw an opportunity to integrate AR/VR into Singapore Airlines' customer experience by showing them a preview of what it would be like to sit in a SIA business class seat while booking a ticket.

fields.title: Vision Poster
fields.subtitle: R/GA APAC
fields.description: The project is a data visualization + generative design that captures collaborative conversations that spark innovation across R/GA offices within the Asia-Pacific region. It has become one of R/GA Singapore’s featured projects to demonstrate creativity and innovativeness.

content.value: The front view lives close to the traditional form of the sound wave. When multiple conversations are happening concurrently, the entire visualization looks like an orchestra with rich textures.

Having a design system significantly speeded up our development time. With those reusable components, the development team focused more on logic and built more than 700 screens and edge cases in a relatively short amount of time.

fields.title: To bring our vision to life, we segmented the models

content.value: To bring our vision to life, we segmented the models into individual parts and added animations to each component. This allowed us to create a dynamic animation for the cabin seats and environment that would appear seamlessly.

The project came from R/GA APAC’s regional initiative to create a Vision Art poster conveying the theme “Collaborate to  Innovate.” Instead of crafting a static poster, we decided to embody the theme in the process of creating the poster, combining design with technology to build something new.

fields.title: Innovation - Led the creation of our method

content.value: Leveraging cutting-edge technologies in computer vision, face tracking, and computer graphics rendering, I directed the development of a unique and innovative age simulation system. This system utilizes the aging patterns derived from our 3D facial data to digitally reproduce the aging process on a user's face in real-time and in 3D.

fields.title: The dynamic relationship between humans an

content.value: The dynamic relationship between humans and the environment is explored in Block Party, where visitors can participate in collaborative placemaking through the playful medium of dance.

Familiar public housing blocks in Singapore come to life as they react to movement prompts from visitors, taking on personalities of their own. As one bends and twists with the buildings, gardens bloom spontaneously over their facades.

This interactive feature is a reminder of the power we wield to shape our surroundings and make a difference to the world. Through light-hearted interactions, participants are called upon to take responsibility for the environment and a sustainable future.

fields.subtitle: Samsung
fields.description: In September 2016, Samsung approached R/GA to build an immersive installation at the 837 flagship space in New York City. Carlos Serrao, R/GA and Samsung combined their expertise in digital ingenuity, photography and technology to present the public with an interactive portrait creation experience that uniquely captures the individual.

fields.title: Design
fields.description: How to visualize “Collaboration”?

content.value: The Dichotomies merged to create a feel of seamlessness, so we told our S narrative through two expressions, a nature-inspired and a tech art expression. One speaks for the reality and the present. The other for the imagination and the possibilities. Both forces as one.

Regarding the exterior design, we utilized 3D printing to create the case of the music player. The case features a ring of white LED lights mounted on its middle layer. The microcontroller inside the case controls the LED lights to illuminate in a sequential loop.

In addition to the live data visualization, which is dynamic and moving, we also designed a static version, which condensed 3 years’ data to 1 single image, just like a timelapse photo. The title “Collaborate to Innovate” was designed to frame the poster to enhance aesthetics.

fields.title: Zig - Design System - Comparison to Flutter Library

content.value: We verified every component based on Google Flutter’s existing widgets early when creating wireframes to guarantee components’ feasibility. All components tightly ‘fit’ the Flutter library but with an entirely distinct, branded look and feel.

fields.title: Zig - Design Engineering - Collaboration with Brand Team

content.value: What the team has done is much more than just implementing existing designs. Instead, we learned the thinking behind designs, worked together with the designers and created experiences that make sense for both sides.

The design engineering practice requires close collaboration with the design team. The collaboration started at the beginning of the project: Early in the brand design phase, we worked with the brand team and built prototypes with code to provide directions on how brand identity can expand into a scalable system.

With this collaborative process, we reduce the delay between ideation to execution. Whenever we landed on a particular idea, we directly moved ahead and implemented it. This inclusive way of working empowered us to boost our best creativity and productivity.

fields.title: Block Party
fields.subtitle: Plug & Play
fields.description: Block Party is an immersive and interactive experience that explores the powerful relationship between humans and our environment. Through the playful and accessible medium of dance, visitors can participate in collaborative placemaking and engage with iconic buildings like never before. The installation has shown in multiple festivals and exhibitions in Singapore, Thailand, and China.

The platform is not just moving people from point A to point B, but to “move” them by igniting feelings of delight and discovery.

fields.title: mood - Starting from a class in ITP

Subsequently, it was invited to be showcased at the annual game convention held by the NYU Game Center and at the Experimental Gamelab.

The i Light Singapore Festival is a leading sustainable light festival in Asia, held in Marina Bay. The event features light art installations by both Singaporean and international artists, using energy-efficient lighting and/or environmentally-friendly materials. fields.title: Plug&Play is a multidisciplinary collective of designers,

content.value: Plug & Play is a multidisciplinary collective of designers, technologists, makers, and engineers who have worked with some of the world’s most innovative brands over the past decade. We work across mediums to create immersive experiences that spark joy and move people. We turn complex issues into simple and interactive solutions that help people imagine the possibilities that we can achieve together.

Heart rate data has been vastly used in health-related fields, representing a user’s fitness stats. Since heart rate can also indicate people’s emotions apart from their physical situations, how about we combining heart rate data with entertainment?

fields.content:
[https://leanstackbyrga.com/](https://leanstackbyrga.com/ "Lean Stack by R/GA")
[https://www.rga.com/news/press-releases/rga-establishes-lean-stack-offering-in-asia-pacific](https://www.rga.com/news/press-releases/rga-establishes-lean-stack-offering-in-asia-pacific "Lean Stack Offering from R/GA")

content.value: The website is designed with Figma and implemented with Vue.js and Nuxt.js frameworks for better performance and stability. The home page is a web canvas showing Three.js animations and interactions. The other pages are composed of modular components customized based on Vuetify.js, where data from Contentful fully control all the content and page layout.

To bring this vision to life, I had to engage in extensive research and perform my own mathematical calculations, as there was no existing library available in the market that could meet my needs. Despite the difficulties, I was determined to create a user-friendly app that would help my wife track her dance practice time and make her journey easier.

Additionally, I added some details such as haptic feedback when users rotating the wheel, similar to winding a watch, which can make the experience of tracking time more enjoyable and engaging, and it helps users to focus on the task at hand. The vibration also provides a sense of accomplishment each time the goal is met.

fields.title: Product Design

content.value: My current portfolio site is an evidence of me learning some latest frameworks and tools of web developments, such as Vue.js, Nuxt.js, and Contentful.

Inspired by harmony and its musical embodiment, the Guzheng, the digital game was designed for a 2 player collaborative experience, complete with custom microcontrollers. The objective for players is to attain preset score based targets at each level, while working in tandem to achieve harmony.

fields.title: Concept - Define “Collaboration to Innovate” for R/GA

content.value: R/GA is a network agency where offices work as one entity globally with the help of the R/GA OS, a suite of tools that allows for easy collaboration across.

We found that while R/GA OS helps the day-to-day operations, it also retains historical collaboration data. Therefore, we designed the poster to visualize these data, which helps showcase this collaboration across offices to clients and others.

ComfortDelGro is a brand synonymous with public transport in Singapore, and one of the largest land transport companies in the world, running fleets of taxis, bus routes, and train lines, amongst others.
However, they’ve been facing intense competition with the rise of Grab and Gojek in recent years and needed to ensure they had a strong focus on digital and tech solutions to adapt to modern times.

R/GA Singapore designed the business and tech stack for Zig – designed based on a consumer behavior-centric approach, where R/GA defined the opportunity areas for the business. Zig was then launched through a mobile app-first platform, built upon a sustainable business model.

Every individual is unique but together, we are not that different.

Our concept is to use the ‘A’ structure as a visual representation of an apprentice, each ‘A’ aims to reflect individual personality. The design of the ‘A’ combines structure based on personality and is complemented with bespoked patterns to reflect emotions. This led to a total visual representation of an apprentice.

fields.title: Glow Shenzhen 2023, a grand light festival, is one of the most important Light Festival in China.

content.value: Glow Shenzhen 2023, a grand light festival, is one of the most important Light Festival in China.

The light festival, which will run through Feb. 25 next year, features 215 works and installations of light art from various countries. It has its main venue set up in Futian District, with five subvenues in Luohu, Nanshan, Bao'an, Longgang, and Guangming districts, and four exhibition sites in Yantian, Longhua, Pingshan, and Dapeng. A total of 33 themed art events will be held during the festival.

content.value: The Light Canvas material causes light drawings to fade after a few minutes, making it difficult to create a single, large drawing without missing parts.

To overcome this challenge, I was inspired by stop motion animation and designed my performance as a sequence of smaller drawings. Each individual drawing was designed to be quick to complete and have a clear connection to the preceding drawing. The narrative was advanced by overlaying new drawings on top of the previous ones.

content.value: Together with the design team, we created an original design language for the new brand and developed it into a design system. It is a truly modular, truly future-proof design system that is used in both product design on Figma and the tech team’s implementation into the app.
The design system consists of 3 important parts:
General app styles (including color, font size, elevation)
Components (such as Button, Card, Dialog, Drawer, Filter, Form, Header, List item, Maps, Snackbar, Tab, etc.)
Responsiveness

content.value: As a result of user feedback, several new functions were added to the app. Previously, users could only manually input the hours they practiced. After receiving requests for an automatic timer, I decided to add this feature while ensuring its proper integration with the existing functions to maintain the app's stability and user experience.

Shiseido opened its Global Innovation Center, located in Yokohama, Japan, in April 2019. The center, which is the world's largest research and development hub and experiential space for cosmetics, was created to demonstrate Shiseido's commitment to innovation and scientific expertise. R/GA Tokyo was commissioned to design an experience for the center's launch that would highlight these qualities.
Concept

Japan boasts the world's fastest aging population, and as a result, a significant portion of the population (9 out of 10) expresses fear of growing old. In Japanese culture, beauty is traditionally defined as a youthful appearance with flawless skin.

As a renowned and iconic beauty brand in Japan, Shiseido has taken on the challenge of expanding this narrow definition of beauty. To do so, we have created an interactive experience aimed at promoting a new understanding of beauty that includes the beauty of aging. The objective is to encourage the recognition of beauty at all stages of life.

fields.title: i Light Singapore is Asia’s leading sustainable light

content.value: The installation was first shown in i Light Singapore in June 2023.

i Light Singapore is Asia’s leading sustainable light festival held in Marina Bay. First held in 2010, i Light Singapore showcases light art installations created by Singaporean and international artists. These artworks are designed with energy-saving lightings and/or environmentally-friendly materials to encourage festival goers and the general public to adopt sustainable habits in their everyday lives. The Festival also features a diverse range of fringe activities for visitors to enjoy, bringing vibrancy to public spaces in our city centre.

To accurately portray personality in a visual expression, we took several steps. Firstly, we utilized two IBM Watson APIs; Personality Insights and Tone Analyzer to test and validate universal writing styles to ascertain distinctive personality differences based on the numerical data returns.

content.value: In January, we presented the AR demo to Singapore Airlines clients and invited them to try the experience for themselves. The clients were impressed by the advancements that AR technology has made and showed great interest in how it could benefit their business.

We also created similar AR demos for Thai Airways and Malaysia Airlines, which generated similar enthusiasm and interest from their clients. These demonstrations showcased the potential impact that AR could have on their businesses.

fields.title: mood - I am utilizing Moteino R4 with RFM69W 915MHz as my RF sensors

content.value: I am utilizing Moteino R4 with RFM69W 915MHz as my RF sensors. I have embedded an RF emitter inside the music player and placed one RF receiver at each corner of the table. By analyzing the signal strength received by each RF receiver (with certain noise filtering), I am able to calculate the relative position of the music player on the table.

fields.title: Zig - Results - From Concept to Launch

content.value: Speed to market was vital in launching the digital venture for ComfortDelGro. With the enormous efforts of the team, Zig was designed and launched on App Stores within only 6 months.

One year since its launch, "Beyond Time" has provided emotional experiences to over 10,000 people. Through more than 30,000 conversations about aging, participants have gained a more positive outlook on growing older. This has allowed Shiseido, a well-known beauty brand, to make a cultural statement that beauty can be found in aging, not just youth.

My performance tells the story of my personal connection with my grandfather, who had a significant impact on my development, education, and personality. Sadly, he passed away a few years ago without me being present. Through this performance, I aim to honor his memory and the legacy he has left behind.

fields.title: Story from the Heart
fields.subtitle: Interactive Cinema
fields.description: "Story from the Heart" is an interactive cinematic experience I developed in Second Story to explore the possibility of combining heart rate data with entertainment. Using XBee and 3D printing, a ball-shaped wireless heart rate monitor constantly sends real-time data to computers. With the video player I built with Chrome extension, the audience can actively affect the combination of movie clips by changing their heart rate. The higher their heart rate is, the more intense the spot will be.

content.value: To drive the aging simulation engine for "Beyond Time," I created a customized 3D facial data capture solution that is both fast and user-friendly. This solution allowed us to collect a comprehensive database of 3D facial scans from over 500 Japanese volunteers. Advanced pattern detection algorithms were then utilized to analyze this data, resulting in the identification of common aging patterns in Japanese faces. These efforts have enabled us to develop a simulation engine that accurately depicts aging in a Japanese population.

This work represents an immense success as the code-generated expressions have been transformed into a commercially viable campaign with global impact. The success affirms the importance of collaboration and partnership between design and technology, even for more traditional mediums like commercials.

fields.title: 1000 Hours
fields.subtitle: A self-made app
fields.description: 1000 Hours is a minimalist habit tracking application created through the combination of my personal skills and tools, including Figma and Flutter. The development process brought together expertise in UI/UX design, design language systems, and app development to create the final product, which was released on major platforms, including the Apple App Store, Android Play Store, and Huawei App Gallery.

content.value: Block Party traveled to Bangkok, Thailand in December 2023, and was exhibited in Bangkok’s largest light and digital arts festival: Awakening Bangkok.
The development and release of the app, powered by Flutter, was a great success as it was launched on three major app platforms, iOS App Store, Google Play Store, and Huawei App Gallery.

However, initially, I received some negative feedback from users about the app's instability. In response, I dedicated numerous hours to improving the app's stability and enhancing the UI/UX design. Through several iterations and redesigns, I received more and more positive feedback from users via email and LinkedIn, who expressed their appreciation for the app.
The key features of 1000 Hours include:
Goal Setting: Set habit goals, such as 1000 hours, and choose fun icons to represent them.
Tracking: Easily track the hours spent practicing each day by manually entering the time or using the built-in timer.
Memo: Keep a record of progress and daily experiences by leaving a diary with text and images.
History: View records in a calendar format to easily track progress over time.

fields.title: Collaboration - Collaborated closely with Jeremy Lin

content.value: In this project, I collaborated closely with Jeremy Lin, a senior designer in R/GA Singapore. Instead of drawing a line between technology and design, we involved each other through the entire process. We ideated together, drew sketches together on whiteboards, solved problems together.

fields.title: After determining the direction for our experience, I conducted research on various AR platforms and techniques, including 8th Wall, Lens Studio, and Spa

content.value: After determining the direction for our experience, I conducted research on various AR platforms and techniques, including 8th Wall, Lens Studio, and Spark Studio. I discovered that these web-based AR platforms were limited in their capabilities and only supported content and models with file sizes less than 10 MB. Additionally, their functionality was limited compared to what could be achieved with native apps, lacking crucial features such as body segmentation and post-processing.

The portrait features movements connected motion blurs created by a long exposure photographic technique. Our generative software mimics the users’ movements by employing the perlin noise algorithm to generate abstractions of visual motion akin to stochastic painting techniques.

The website displays an interactive 3D model of the Samsung Galaxy S8. It allows users to trigger and explore the new phone features, including infinity display, iris scanner, Bixby vision, autofocus camera, and water resistant. In this way, users can become familiar with the highlight features of the new Samsung Galaxy S8 and pre-order.
